questions.text: A patient presented with fatigue, pallor. Investigations show Hb = 5.8 gm/dl, low MCV, low ferritin, high TIBC, and high RDW. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Iron Deficiency Anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron deficiency anemia is characterized by low hemoglobin , low MCV , low ferritin , high TIBC , and high RDW , which together point towards iron deficiency as the cause of the anemia.
  • ➤ Iron deficiency anemia
  • ➤ low hemoglobin
  • ➤ low MCV
  • ➤ low ferritin
  • ➤ high TIBC
  • ➤ high RDW

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic presented with pruritic eczematous rash on the neck and dorsum of the hands. What is the likely nutritional deficiency?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Vitamin B3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A pruritic, photosensitive rash in a chronic alcoholic is most suggestive of pellagra , which results from Vitamin B3 (Niacin) deficiency. Alcoholism is a known risk factor for this deficiency.
  • ➤ pellagra
  • ➤ Vitamin B3 (Niacin)

questions.text: A patient was given 0.5% bupivacaine for a supraclavicular brachial plexus block and suddenly developed hypotension and arrhythmias. Which of the following is the 1st line of management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 20% IV Intralipid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of bupivacaine toxicity resulting in cardiovascular complications like hypotension and arrhythmias, 20% IV Intralipid is the first-line therapy. It acts by sequestering the local anesthetic, thereby reducing its toxicity to the heart and other organs.
  • ➤ bupivacaine toxicity
  • ➤ 20% IV Intralipid

questions.text: A patient with suspected tuberculosis underwent CBNAAT testing and is started on HRZE. CBNAAT is helpful for which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) MTB + Rifampicin resistance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CBNAAT is a valuable tool for detecting Mycobacterium tuberculosis and rifampicin resistance , but it does not provide information on resistance to other drugs like isoniazid or ethambutol. For broader drug resistance testing, other methods such as line probe assays are required.
  • ➤ CBNAAT
  • ➤ Mycobacterium tuberculosis
  • ➤ rifampicin resistance
  • ➤ line probe assays

questions.text: A pregnant female who is a known case of bronchial asthma presented to hospital with blood pressure of 210/110 mm Hg. Which of the following is the preferred drug for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Nifedipine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pregnant women with hypertension and a history of bronchial asthma , Nifedipine is the preferred treatment as it effectively lowers blood pressure without causing bronchospasm, while beta-blockers like labetalol and ACE inhibitors like ramipril are contraindicated.
  • ➤ bronchial asthma
  • ➤ Nifedipine
  • ➤ beta-blockers
  • ➤ labetalol
  • ➤ ACE inhibitors
  • ➤ ramipril

questions.text: In primary accidental hypothermia, what is the usual rate of rewarming with passive external rewarming?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 0.5-2°C per hour

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The usual rate of rewarming with passive external rewarming in primary accidental hypothermia is 0.5-2°C per hour , allowing the body to generate its own heat and recover gradually.
  • ➤ passive external rewarming
  • ➤ primary accidental hypothermia
  • ➤ 0.5-2°C per hour

questions.text: Which of the following when consumed with oral iron reduces its absorption?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Tea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tea consumption along with oral iron can reduce its absorption due to the presence of tannins, whereas foods rich in vitamin C, such as lemon or amla juice, enhance iron absorption.
  • ➤ Tea
  • ➤ reduce its absorption

questions.text: Patient after road traffic accident was brought to the emergency. His pulse rate was 50 beats per minute, Blood pressure was 80/ 60 mm of Hg. On evaluation his ECG was normal, eFAST was negative and chest X-Ray was normal. This status of patient could be best classified under which type of shock?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Neurogenic shock

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neurogenic shock is characterized by bradycardia and hypotension in the absence of blood loss or cardiac issues, often following trauma, particularly spinal injury.
  • ➤ Neurogenic shock
  • ➤ bradycardia
  • ➤ hypotension

questions.text: CT scan given in the image is suggestive of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Subdural hematoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A crescent-shaped hyperdense lesion on a CT scan is characteristic of a subdural hematoma , typically resulting from venous bleeding following trauma.
  • ➤ crescent-shaped hyperdense lesion
  • ➤ subdural hematoma

questions.text: Identify the lesion in the chest X-ray:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cannon ball metastases

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cannon ball metastases are large, round nodules seen in both lung fields on a chest X-ray and are associated with metastatic cancer, most commonly from renal cell carcinoma and other malignancies.
  • ➤ Cannon ball metastases

questions.text: Plasmodium species that commonly cause Membranous nephropathy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Malariae

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Plasmodium malariae is the species most commonly linked to membranous nephropathy in malaria-endemic regions, causing immune complex-mediated kidney damage leading to nephrotic syndrome.
  • ➤ Plasmodium malariae
  • ➤ membranous nephropathy

questions.text: A 2-month-old pregnant female presented with vivax malaria. What is the most appropriate management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chloroquine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For the treatment of Plasmodium vivax malaria in early pregnancy, chloroquine is the drug of choice due to its safety profile for both the mother and fetus.
  • ➤ chloroquine

questions.text: What adverse effect is NOT seen with amiodarone?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gynaecomastia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amiodarone is associated with multiple adverse effects, including thyroid dysfunction (both hypo- and hyperthyroidism) and pulmonary fibrosis. Gynaecomastia is not a typical side effect of amiodarone.
  • ➤ Gynaecomastia

questions.text: A schizophrenic patient after receiving haloperidol developed torticollis and dystonia. What will be the best drug in this situation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Give benzhexol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The best treatment for acute dystonia caused by typical antipsychotics like haloperidol is to administer an anticholinergic medication such as benzhexol (trihexyphenidyl) , which can quickly relieve the symptoms.
  • ➤ acute dystonia
  • ➤ anticholinergic medication
  • ➤ benzhexol (trihexyphenidyl)

questions.text: Identify the pathology from the given flow-volume loop:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Fixed central airway obstruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A flow-volume loop showing flattening of both the inspiratory and expiratory limbs indicates a fixed central airway obstruction , which can be caused by tracheal stenosis or large airway tumors.
  • ➤ flow-volume loop
  • ➤ fixed central airway obstruction

questions.text: Identify the urinary crystal shown below:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Calcium oxalate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Calcium oxalate crystals have a distinct envelope shape and are commonly found in various urinary conditions, particularly in patients with kidney stones.
  • ➤ envelope shape

questions.text: A 50-year-old man suddenly developed right-sided weakness and aphasia within 2 hours. His BP recorded was 160/100 mmHg and NCCT was normal. What is the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: CT angiography to look for large vessel occlusion

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Thrombolysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient with acute ischemic stroke presenting within the therapeutic window and a normal NCCT, thrombolysis is the immediate next step in management, aiming to restore blood flow and improve outcomes.
  • ➤ thrombolysis

questions.text: For the diagnosis of resistant hypertension, the patient should have uncontrolled hypertension despite taking three antihypertensive drugs. This should include at least one:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Diuretic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a diagnosis of resistant hypertension , the patient must have uncontrolled blood pressure despite taking three antihypertensive agents, including at least one diuretic .
  • ➤ resistant hypertension
  • ➤ one diuretic
